s.text: Time and Life (not the magazines) often cool formerly warm relationships.

This may be what they've been waiting for so that they can talk about the past and apologize.
Because we see no sense in causing more financial distress than necessary, we are still under the same roof while we work out the details.
Because you refer to her as "selfish," however, you may not wish to keep this arrangement going forever.
This may totally louse up the living situation, so be prepared.
Since his move, however, our friendship has hit some snags.
Should I take her out again, or just give her a small gift and forget our tradition of the birthday dinner?
Should I take her out again, or just give her a small gift and forget our tradition of the birthday dinner?
Should I take her out again, or just give her a small gift and forget our tradition of the birthday dinner?
If she remarks on the "tradition" being different for her birthday this year than last, simply tell her that you are following her lead about what level of celebration is appropriate.
Next time such a question is posed, ask them if they really want the answer.
